job.title: Chef-fe de projet Restauration

company.name: EPFL - Ecole Polytechnique Fédérale de Lausanne

job.plaincontent:
L’Ecole polytechnique fédérale de Lausanne (EPFL), est l’un des campus universitaires les plus dynamiques en Europe et s’inscrit dans le top 20 mondial de nombreux classements académiques. L’EPFL compte près de 6'000 collaboratrices et collaborateurs qui font vivre les trois missions principales de l’Ecole : la formation, la recherche et l’innovation. Le campus de l’EPFL offre un cadre de travail exceptionnel au cœur d’une communauté de 16'000 personnes dont plus de 10'000 étudiants et 3500 chercheurs issus de 120 nationalités différentes.
Chef-fe de projet Restauration
Mission :
- Mettre en œuvre les mesures et le suivi de la nouvelle stratégie de la restauration auprès de tous les points de restauration et des antennes cantonales. - Coordination administrative entre les différents partenaires de développement
Principales tâches et responsabilités :
- Audit Stratégie 20/30 en lien avec la plateforme Altella - Collaboration à l’établissement des bilans annuels - Mise en place et suivi des résultats des critères d’évaluation - Participation à la gestion des différents projets culinaires en lien avec le développement de la restauration - Suivi du contrôle des résultats et des normes à mettre en place pour l’EPFL et les Antennes - Participation à la gestion des différents projets de construction des nouveaux restaurants et points de ventes - Soutien à la coordination des appels d’offre restauration - Suivi et engagements contractuels liés aux points de la Stratégie restauration 20/30.
Profil recherché :
- Diplôme d’une Ecole Hôtelière reconnue - Expérience significative en gestion de projet - Références en restauration collective - Bonne connaissance managériale - Très bonne maîtrise des outils informatiques - Langue française courante oral et écrit - Maîtrise de l’anglais un atout
Nous offrons :
- Environnement de travail très dynamique et international - Une activité intéressante et variée dans un environnement de travail agréable - Ambiance de travail agréable et esprit de collaboration - Diversité dans les tâches
Date d'entrée en fonction : 01.01.2021 Type de contrat : Durée indéterminée (CDI) Taux d'occupation : 100% Durée : Indéterminée Contact : Des renseignements complémentaires peuvent être obtenus auprès de Mme Lucie Durussel par e-mail à restauration@epfl.ch Remarque : Seuls les candidats ayant postulé via le site internet de l'EPFL ou celui de notre partenaire Jobup seront pris en compte.postuler en ligne
job.htmlcontent:
L’Ecole polytechnique fédérale de Lausanne (EPFL), est l’un des campus universitaires les plus dynamiques en Europe et s’inscrit dans le top 20 mondial de nombreux classements académiques. L’EPFL compte près de 6'000 collaboratrices et collaborateurs qui font vivre les trois missions principales de l’Ecole : la formation, la recherche et l’innovation. Le campus de l’EPFL offre un cadre de travail exceptionnel au cœur d’une communauté de 16'000 personnes dont plus de 10'000 étudiants et 3500 chercheurs issus de 120 nationalités différentes.

Chef-fe de projet Restauration

Mission :
  • Mettre en œuvre les mesures et le suivi de la nouvelle stratégie de la restauration auprès de tous les points de restauration et des antennes cantonales.
  • Coordination administrative entre les différents partenaires de développement
Principales tâches et responsabilités :
  • Audit Stratégie 20/30 en lien avec la plateforme Altella
  • Collaboration à l’établissement des bilans annuels
  • Mise en place et suivi des résultats des critères d’évaluation
  • Participation à la gestion des différents projets culinaires en lien avec le développement de la restauration
  • Suivi du contrôle des résultats et des normes à mettre en place pour l’EPFL et les Antennes
  • Participation à la gestion des différents projets de construction des nouveaux restaurants et points de ventes
  • Soutien à la coordination des appels d’offre restauration
  • Suivi et engagements contractuels liés aux points de la Stratégie restauration 20/30. 
Profil recherché :
  • Diplôme d’une Ecole Hôtelière reconnue
  • Expérience significative en gestion de projet
  • Références en restauration collective
  • Bonne connaissance managériale
  • Très bonne maîtrise des outils informatiques
  • Langue française courante oral et écrit
  • Maîtrise de l’anglais un atout
Nous offrons :
  • Environnement de travail très dynamique et international
  • Une activité intéressante et variée dans un environnement de travail agréable
  • Ambiance de travail agréable et esprit de collaboration
  • Diversité dans les tâches
Date d'entrée en fonction :
01.01.2021 Type de contrat :
Durée indéterminée (CDI) Taux d'occupation :
100% Durée :
Indéterminée
Contact :
Des renseignements complémentaires peuvent être obtenus auprès de Mme Lucie Durussel par e-mail à restauration@epfl.ch Remarque :
Seuls les candidats ayant postulé via le site internet de l'EPFL ou celui de notre partenaire Jobup seront pris en compte.postuler en ligne

job.title: Dipl. Pflegefachfrau/Pflegefachmann HF/FH/DNII
job.plaincontent:
Tertianum trägt als Marktführer im Bereich Leben, Wohnen und Pflege im Alter entscheidend zur Verbesserung der Lebensqualität älterer Menschen bei. Wir sind mit Residenzen und Wohn- und Pflegezentren an rund 80 Standorten in der ganzen Schweiz vertreten. Wir ermöglichen attraktive Berufsperspektiven und bieten vielseitige Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten an.
Die exklusive Tertianum Parkresidenz Meilen verfügt über 53 Residenzwohnungen mit Spitexleistungen, eine Pflegeabteilung mit 20 Einzelzimmern sowie einen betreuten Wohnbereich mit 7 Einzelzimmern. Den Gästen wird gelebte Gastfreundschaft, stillvolles Ambiente und attraktive Services an privilegierter Lage geboten. Das Parkrestaurant mit seiner mediterranen Terrasse ist auch bei externen Gästen sehr beliebt.
Wir suchen per 1. September oder nach Vereinbarung eine/n
Dipl. Pflegefachfrau/Pflegefachmann HF/FH/DNII (100 %)
Ihre Aufgaben
- Ganzheitliche Betreuung und Pflege der Gäste im Sinne des Leitbildes und des Pflegeprozesses - Ausführen von behandlungspflegerischen Tätigkeiten - Planung und Begleitung von Arztvisiten - Dokumentation der Pflege - Übernahme von Aufgaben als Bezugsperson - Steuerung des Pflegeprozesses - Leitung von Fallbesprechungen
Ihr Profil
- Abgeschlossene Ausbildung zur/zum Dipl. Pflegefachfrau/Pflegefachmann HF/FH/DNII oder eine gleichwertige, durch das SRK anerkannte Ausbildung - Berufserfahrung in der Langzeitpflege erwünscht - CareCoach- und BESA Kenntnisse von Vorteil - Ausbildung und Erfahrung als Berufsbildner/-in - Wundmanagement-Kenntnisse von Vorteil - Sichere Kommunikation in der deutschen Sprache in Wort und Schrift - Eine herzliche und humorvolle Grundeinstellung
Unser Team freut sich auf tatkräftige und charismatische Mitgestalter*innen. Erkennen Sie sich? So freuen wir uns, Sie persönlich kennenzulernen!
Wir bitten Sie um Verständnis, dass Bewerbungen ausschliesslich online über dieses Bewerbungsportal bearbeitet werden können.
Für Fragen steht Ihnen Flavia Güdemann, Leiterin Pflege und Betreuung, unter der Telefonnummer 044 925 06 54 gerne zur Verfügung.

job.title: Fachfrau/Fachmann Gesundheit EFZ
job.plaincontent:
Tertianum trägt als Marktführer im Bereich Leben, Wohnen und Pflege im Alter entscheidend zur Verbesserung der Lebensqualität älterer Menschen bei. Wir sind mit Residenzen und Wohn- und Pflegezentren an rund 80 Standorten in der ganzen Schweiz vertreten. Wir ermöglichen attraktive Berufsperspektiven und bieten vielseitige Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten an.
Das Wohn- und Pflegezentrum Tertianum Chly-Wabere bietet 54 gemütliche Wohnungen und einen Pflegewohnbereich mit 12 Pflege-Einzelzimmern. Den Gästen kommen in den Genuss gelebter Gastfreundschaft und eines attraktiven Dienstleistungsangebotes in einem rustikalen Ambiente.
Wir suchen per sofort oder nach Vereinbarung eine/n
Fachfrau/Fachmann Gesundheit EFZ (80 % - 100 %)
Ihre Aufgaben
- Pflege und Betreuung der Gäste in alltäglichen und anspruchsvollen Situationen - Elektronische Pflegedokumentation mittels "Care-Coach" - Behandlungspflegerische und medizinaltechnische Verrichtungen - Mitarbeit bei der Umsetzung des Pflegeprozesses und Übernahme der Bezugspflege - Übernahme von Nachtdiensten
Ihr Profil
- Eine herzliche und humorvolle Grundeinstellung - Abgeschlossene Ausbildung zur/zum Fachfrau/Fachmann Gesundheit EFZ - Erfahrung in der Langzeitpflege (von Vorteil) - Sichere Kommunikation in Deutsch (mündlich und schriftlich)

Für Fragen steht Ihnen Ursula Jäger, Geschäftsführerin, unter der Telefonnummer 031 960 60 60 gerne zur Verfügung.

job.title: Pflegefachfrau/Pflegefachmann HF/FH 80-100% Akutstation
job.plaincontent:
Pflegefachfrau/Pflegefachmann HF/FH 80-100% Akutstationin Kilchberg bei Zürich Ihre fünf Top-Vorteile auf einen Blick:
- Besonders stilvolle Anlage 10 Minuten von Zürich - Familiäre Atmosphäre - Interessante und abwechslungsreiche Arbeit - Grosszügige Unterstützung von Kursen, Veranstaltungen und längeren Ausbildungen - Sie werden Teil eines sehr offenen, humorvollen und herzlichen Teams
Ihr Profil:
- Sie sind Pflegefachperson HF/FH mit Herz und Verstand, die Pflege auf Augenhöhe mit Patienten verrichtet - Unsere Patientinnen und Patienten sowie unser Behandlungsteam profitieren von Ihrer beruflichen Erfahrung aus dem psychiatrischen Bereich, vorzugsweise der Akutpsychiatrie - Durch Ihre Offenheit und Flexibilität gelingt es Ihnen, unsere Patientinnen und Patienten individuell in der Behandlung ihrer Abhängigkeitserkrankung zu begleiten - Ihre zuverlässige und selbständige Arbeitsweise trägt zur Erhaltung unserer gemeinschaftlichen Teamkultur bei
Ihr Job:
- Bezugspflege sowie Angehörigenarbeit auf einer Akutstation mit Schwerpunkt Abhängigkeitserkrankungen - "Hand in Hand"- Arbeiten im Kernteam: Zusammen mit der Fallführung gestalten Sie geeignete Behandlungsverläufe für Ihre Patientinnen und Patienten - "Nicht für Betroffene, sondern gemeinsam mit Betroffenen!": Durch ihre recovery- orientierte Haltung und Handlung befähigen Sie unsere Patientinnen und Patienten dazu, deren gewünschte Selbstständigkeit wieder zu erlangen - Zusammen mit den Berufsbildnern und unserer Pflegepädagogik geben Sie Ihr Fachwissen an unsere Studierende im Stationsalltag weiter
Weitere Pluspunkte für Sie:
- Viel Gestaltungsspielraum und rasche Entscheidungswege - Überdurchschnittlich abwechslungsreiches, interdisziplinäres Arbeiten - Gesund und günstig essen im Personalrestaurant mit Panoramaterrasse
Fachliche Fragen beantwortet gerne: Mirco Müller Stationleiter D1 Tel. +41 44 716 38 71 Jetzt bewerbenPersonalberater

job.title: Technical Officer (Tripartite Joint Secretariat)
job.plaincontent:
Technical Officer (Tripartite Joint Secretariat) - (2002626) Grade: P4Contractual Arrangement: Temporary appointment under Staff Rule 420.4Contract Duration (Years, Months, Days): 12 months:
Job Posting
: Jul 7, 2020, 9:39:09 AM
Closing Date
: Jul 27, 2020, 9:59:00 PM
Primary Location
: Switzerland-Geneva
Organization
: HQ/GCP Global Coordination and Partnership
Schedule
: Full-time IMPORTANT NOTICE: Please note that the deadline for receipt of applications indicated above reflects your personal device's system settings.
OBJECTIVES OF THE PROGRAMME
TheTripartite organizations established a standing Tripartite Joint Secretariat (TJS) to lead and coordinate the global response to antimicrobial resistance in close collaboration with the UN system and other organizations. The TJS consolidates cooperation between WHO, FAO and OIE drawing on their core mandate and comparative advantages to address the wide range of needs of the global response against antimicrobial resistance. The Secretariat will play key role in integrating and promoting the essential components of the One Health spectrum of human, animal and plant health, as well as food and feed and the environment for effective global response on antimicrobial resistance in close collaboration with the UN Environment, the World Bank and other UN and international organizations, Member States, civil society and the private sector. As part of these efforts and to ensure coordinated action and sustainable financing for catalyzing national level action, the Tripartite has established the ‘Combatting Antimicrobial Resistance through a One Health approach: AMR Multi-Partner Trust Fund (AMR MPTF). The AMR MPTF is established for an initial five-year period (2019-2024) and enables stronger and sustained global leadership and advocacy to advance the global response to AMR, by raising the profile and urgency of addressing AMR, building and maintaining political momentum and public support, scaling up the technical capacity of the Tripartite to tackle AMR in human, animal and plant health and food and environment sectors in countries through joint and coordinated actions to develop, implement and scale up One Health NAPs through Tripartite cooperation.The strength of the Tripartite is founded on the long-standing partnership, combined technical knowledge and global convening power of the three organizations; collectively they offer robust, cost-effective and efficient solutions to addressing complex health problems faced by the global community.
DESCRIPTION OF DUTIES
- Manages and coordinates the overall AMR MPTF activities including the development and follow up of work planning of participating organisations, the Steering Committee and day-to-day functions within the TJS. - Supports the development by country and global technical teams of project proposals, including facilitating linkages between the country teams and Tripartite substantive policy experts at regional and global levels. - Coordinates the calls for proposals and convenes the necessary technical expertise to appraise such proposals and monitors the implementation of approved projects with support from and other participating partner entities.- Ensures the monitoring of operational risks of the AMR MPTF to deliver on its objectives.- Liaises with the Administrative Agent (MPTFO) on fund administration issues, including issues related to project/fund extensions and project/fund closures.- Manages and consolidates and submits timely periodic, annual and writes final narrative reports on Fund and country progress, in accordance with the agreed results framework and respective indicators, including on the activities of the Secretariat.- Identifies and supports the Tripartite to develop strategic and innovative partnerships with other entities, initiatives and/or organizations, especially multilateral partners; the private sector, including investors and civil society to enhance the impact of the Fund in the global AMR response.- Supports AMR MPTF resource mobilization (RM) efforts through managing the design and implementation of an RM Action plan, from traditional and non-traditional donors, foundations, the private sector.- Performs all other related duties as assigned.
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
Education
Essential : An advanced university degree in management, international development, international relations, public administration, public policy or other relevant social sciences. Desirable : Training on results-based or risk management.
Experience
Essential : A minimum of 7 years project management experience in international development in a multilateral or civil society organization and in coordinating and managing funds or large-scale multi-stakeholder initiatives, including results-based management or risk management, or resource mobilization. Demonstrated experience at the international level. Desirable : Experience working in financing for development and experience in innovative financing, joint programming and partnerships will be significant assets.Experience working in the area of One Health or antimicrobial resistance.
Skills
Excellent project management skills; strong skills in external relations and resource mobilization; possess knowledge of financing for development and the ability to work in partnership across organizations; excellent knowledge management and ability to lead strategic planning, results-based management and reporting for an inter-agency Pooled Fund; builds strong relationships with clients, focuses on impact and result for the client and responds positively to feedback. Possess a demonstrated ability of working and managing multi-stakeholder initiatives. Concrete skills and knowledge working with ERP systems. An understanding of antimicrobial resistance, and One Health issues would be an advantage.
WHO Competencies
Teamwork Respecting and promoting individual and cultural differences Communication Producing results Moving forward in a changing environment Creating an empowering and motivating environment
Use of Language Skills
Essential : Expert knowledge of English. Desirable : Intermediate knowledge of other WHO Language.
REMUNERATION
WHO salaries for staff in the Professional category are calculated in US dollars. The remuneration for the above position comprises an annual base salary starting at USD 73,516 (subject to mandatory deductions for pension contributions and health insurance, as applicable), a variable post adjustment, which reflects the cost of living in a particular duty station, and currently amounts to USD 5091 per month for the duty station indicated above. Other benefits include 30 days of annual leave, allowances for dependent family members, home leave, and an education grant for dependent children.
ADDITIONAL INFORMATION
- This vacancy notice may be used to fill other similar positions at the same grade level
- Only candidates under serious consideration will be contacted.
- A written test may be used as a form of screening.
- In the event that your candidature is retained for an interview, you will be required to provide, in advance, a scanned copy of the degree(s)/diploma(s)/certificate(s) required for this position. WHO only considers higher educational qualifications obtained from an institution accredited/recognized in the World Higher Education Database (WHED), a list updated by the International Association of Universities (IAU)/United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO). The list can be accessed through the link: http://www.whed.net/. Some professional certificates may not appear in the WHED and will require individual review.
- Any appointment/extension of appointment is subject to WHO Staff Regulations, Staff Rules and Manual.
- Staff members in other duty stations are encouraged to apply.
- For information on WHO's operations please visit: http://www.who.int.
- WHO is committed to workforce diversity.
- WHO's workforce adheres to the WHO Values Charter and is committed to put the WHO Values into practice.
- WHO has a smoke-free environment and does not recruit smokers or users of any form of tobacco.
- WHO has a mobility policy which can be found at the following link:http://www.who.int/employment/en/. Candidates appointed to an international post with WHO are subject to mobility and may be assigned to any activity or duty station of the Organization throughout the world.
- Applications from women and from nationals of non and underrepresented Member States are particularly encouraged.

Desirable: Training on results-based or risk management.

Experience

Essential: A minimum of 7 years project management experience in international development in a multilateral or civil society organization and in coordinating and managing funds or large-scale multi-stakeholder initiatives, including results-based management or risk management, or resource mobilization. Demonstrated experience at the international level.
Desirable: Experience working in financing for development and experience in innovative financing, joint programming and partnerships will be significant assets.Experience working in the area of One Health or antimicrobial resistance.

Skills

Excellent project management skills; strong skills in external relations and resource mobilization; possess knowledge of financing for development and the ability to work in partnership across organizations; excellent knowledge management and ability to lead strategic planning, results-based management and reporting for an inter-agency Pooled Fund; builds strong relationships with clients, focuses on impact and result for the client and responds positively to feedback. Possess a demonstrated ability of working and managing multi-stakeholder initiatives. Concrete skills and knowledge working with ERP systems. An understanding of antimicrobial resistance, and One Health issues would be an advantage.

WHO Competencies

Teamwork
Respecting and promoting individual and cultural differences
Communication
Producing results
Moving forward in a changing environment
Creating an empowering and motivating environment

Use of Language Skills

Essential: Expert knowledge of English.
Desirable: Intermediate knowledge of other WHO Language.

REMUNERATION

WHO salaries for staff in the Professional category are calculated in US dollars. The remuneration for the above position comprises an annual base salary starting at USD 73,516 (subject to mandatory deductions for pension contributions and health insurance, as applicable), a variable post adjustment, which reflects the cost of living in a particular duty station, and currently amounts to USD 5091 per month for the duty station indicated above. Other benefits include 30 days of annual leave, allowances for dependent family members, home leave, and an education grant for dependent children.

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION

  • This vacancy notice may be used to fill other similar positions at the same grade level
  • Only candidates under serious consideration will be contacted.
  • A written test may be used as a form of screening.
  • In the event that your candidature is retained for an interview, you will be required to provide, in advance, a scanned copy of the degree(s)/diploma(s)/certificate(s) required for this position. WHO only considers higher educational qualifications obtained from an institution accredited/recognized in the World Higher Education Database (WHED), a list updated by the International Association of Universities (IAU)/United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO). The list can be accessed through the link: http://www.whed.net/. Some professional certificates may not appear in the WHED and will require individual review.
  • Any appointment/extension of appointment is subject to WHO Staff Regulations, Staff Rules and Manual.
  • Staff members in other duty stations are encouraged to apply.
  • For information on WHO's operations please visit: http://www.who.int.
  • WHO is committed to workforce diversity.
  • WHO's workforce adheres to the WHO Values Charter and is committed to put the WHO Values into practice.
  • WHO has a smoke-free environment and does not recruit smokers or users of any form of tobacco.
  • WHO has a mobility policy which can be found at the following link:http://www.who.int/employment/en/. Candidates appointed to an international post with WHO are subject to mobility and may be assigned to any activity or duty station of the Organization throughout the world.
  • Applications from women and from nationals of non and underrepresented Member States are particularly encouraged.

job.title: Operator PCP (Potent Compound Production)
job.plaincontent: Lonza ist heute ein weltweit führendes Unternehmen im Bereich Life Sciences mit mehr als 100 Produktionsstandorten und Niederlassungen sowie rund 15‘000 Vollzeitmitarbeitenden weltweit. Wir sind in der Wissenschaft tätig, jedoch gibt es keine Zauberformel dafür, wie wir die Arbeit angehen. Unsere wichtigste wissenschaftliche Lösung sind talentierte Mitarbeitende, die zusammenarbeiten und Ideen entwickeln, die anderen Unternehmen helfen, Menschen zu helfen. Am Standort Visp wird ein/e Operator/in für den Bereich PCP gesucht. Ihre Aufgaben : - Selbstständiges Fahren der ihm vertrauten Teile der Produktionsanlage gemäss Vorgabedokumenten (Herstellungsprotokolle / Bedienungsanleitungen / Arbeitsanweisungen / SOP) - Berücksichtigung der cGMP Qualitätsanforderungen - Richtige Arbeitsausführung und korrekte Protokollierung - Vermeidung von Produkte- und Anlagenverunreinigungen mit Fremdstoffen - Sichere Arbeitsausführung unter Einhaltung der Sicherheitsvorschriften und SOP - Melden und Beheben von Mängeln und Störungen in der Anlage inklusive deren Dokumentation - Verantwortung für Sauberkeit und Ordnung am Arbeitsplatz sowie den zugewiesenen Räumen und Lagern - Erledigen von Überwachungs-, Instandhaltungs- und Reinigungsarbeiten - Jeder Operator/in im Betrieb ist als gleichwertiges Teammitglied durch Seine/Ihre aktive Mithilfe an kontinuierlichen Verbesserungsprozessen beteiligt Ihr Anforderungsprofil: - Abgeschlossene Berufsausbildung (Eidgenössisches Fachzeugnis EFZ) vorausgesetzt - Chemische oder pharmatechnologische Ausbildung sowie GMP und/oder BICO Ausbildung von Vorteil - Akkurate Arbeits- und Dokumentationsweise - Ausführen der Arbeiten mit hohem Sicherheitsbewusstsein - Arbeiten mit dem Computer (Excel, Word sowie Prozessleitsystemen) - Bereitschaft zur Schichtarbeit (4-Schicht-Betrieb) mit Flexibilität bei der Arbeitseinteilung Lonza’s Produkte und Services wirken sich täglich positiv auf Millionen von Menschen aus. job.title: MSAT Senior Scientist (HAPI Kilo Suites)
job.plaincontent: Lonza ist heute ein weltweit führendes Unternehmen im Bereich Life Sciences mit mehr als 100 Produktionsstandorten und Niederlassungen sowie rund 15‘000 Vollzeitmitarbeitenden weltweit. Wir sind in der Wissenschaft tätig, jedoch gibt es keine Zauberformel dafür, wie wir die Arbeit angehen. Unsere wichtigste wissenschaftliche Lösung sind talentierte Mitarbeitende, die zusammenarbeiten und Ideen entwickeln, die anderen Unternehmen helfen, Menschen zu helfen. Im Gegenzug steuern unsere Mitarbeitenden ihre Karriere selbstständig. Denn ihre Ideen, ob gross und klein, verbessern die Welt. Und das ist die Art von Arbeit, an der wir Teil haben möchten. Für unseren Standort in Visp suchen wir einen Senior Scientist MSAT für den Bereich der hochaktiven Substanzen. Ihre Aufgaben: - Der Senior Scientist MSAT (HAPI Kilo Suites) initiiert und unterstützt die Einführung der Verbesserungen der kommerziellen Prozesse in den HAPI Kilo Suites in enger Zusammenarbeit mit dem Produktionspersonal, Projektteam und Kunden. - Er ist verantwortlich für die Erstellung und Ausführung von Laborprogrammen zur Optimierung der zugewiesenen Produktionsprozesse, für den direkten Prozess Transfer kommerzieller Prozesse nach Laborbearbeitung in die HAPI Kilo Suites und unterstützt die Produktion bei der Bearbeitung von Problemen (Troubleshooting). - In seiner Rolle als MSAT Chemiker entwickelt er ein exzellentes Prozessverständnis und sichert eine robuste Verfahrensführung und Produktion. - Er führt und entwickelt die zugewiesenen Laboranten, und leistet in der Abteilung einen Beitrag als Prozessoptimierungs-Spezialist. Ihr Anforderungsprofil: - Hochschulausbildung als Chemiker (Ph.D. oder gleichwertige Berufserfahrung) in synthetischer organischer Chemie - Erfahrung in Scale up und Prozessentwicklung sind erwünscht, Kenntnisse in Problemlösungstechniken, statistische Versuchsplanung oder cGMP sind von Vorteil. - Sie sind flexibel, selbständig und besitzen eine gute Kommunikations- und Teamfähigkeit sowie Freude an interdisziplinärer Zusammenarbeit. - Gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse sind erforderlich.   • Er führt und entwickelt die zugewiesenen Laboranten, und leistet in der Abteilung einen Beitrag als Prozessoptimierungs-Spezialist.

Ihr Anforderungsprofil:

  • Hochschulausbildung als Chemiker (Ph.D. oder gleichwertige Berufserfahrung) in synthetischer organischer Chemie
  • Erfahrung in Scale up und Prozessentwicklung sind erwünscht, Kenntnisse in Problemlösungstechniken, statistische Versuchsplanung oder cGMP sind von Vorteil.
  • Sie sind flexibel, selbständig und besitzen eine gute Kommunikations- und Teamfähigkeit sowie Freude an interdisziplinärer Zusammenarbeit.
  • Gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse sind erforderlich.

Lonza’s Produkte und Services wirken sich täglich positiv auf Millionen von Menschen aus. Für uns stellt dies nicht nur eine grosse Ehre, sondern auch eine grosse Verantwortung, dar. Wie wir unsere Geschäftsergebnisse erreichen ist für uns genauso wichtig wie unsere Erfolge selbst. Bei Lonza wird Respekt grossgeschrieben und wir schützen sowohl unsere Mitarbeiter als auch unsere Umwelt.Erfolg für uns bedeutet moralisch vertretbarer Fortschritt.

Menschen werden Teil der Lonza, um herausfordernde und komplexe Problemstellungen durch kreative und innovative Ansätze im Bereich Life Sciences zu lösen. Im Gegenzug bieten wir die Zufriedenheit, die mit der Verbesserung des Lebens auf der ganzen Welt einhergeht. Die Zufriedenheit, die damit einhergeht, einen sinnvollen Unterschied zu machen.

job.title: Project Engineer / CAPEX Lead
Software Engineer
job.plaincontent:
Requisition ID: 257286 Work Area: Software-Design and Development Expected Travel: 0 - 10% Career Status: Professional Employment Type: Regular Full Time
COMPANY DESCRIPTION
SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.
SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.
PURPOSE AND OBJECTIVES
Now more than ever before businesses around the world need to accelerate the transformation of core processes in a flexible way. To support this, our business unit SAP S/4HANA Consumer Industries Cloud will focus on building new cloud products for customers in the Consumer Product, Retail, Wholesale and Life Science industries.
Taking a start-up approach, SAP S/4HANA Consumer Industries Cloud will bring together product strategy and management with all the necessary cloud business functions such as architecture, engineering and operations. Development in this unit will focus on cloud-native applications.
With a view of Lake Constance, the SAP office at Tägerwilen is home to a team of domain and engineering experts. Our focus is on forecasting, planning and replenishment uses cases in Retail and Consumer industries. In addition to the regular setup of Scrum teams, the engineering team includes data science experts to develop and make use of state-of-the-art scientific concepts. Embedded in the international setup of our business unit, we are collaborating with teams located in Germany, Canada, the United States, and China.
Join our team of highly motivated colleagues. We treat each other as equals, have an outstanding team spirit and a great working atmosphere. In your role as software engineer, you will contribute to the development of new products and features. You will work on all phases of the software development lifecycle and use the Scrum methodology and best practices for agile software development. .
EXPECTATIONS AND TASKS
You will be working in a cross-functional Scrum team. As software developer, you will directly contribute to the implementation and release of new products and product updates. More specifically, your tasks and responsibilities will include the following:
- Analyze and understand business requirements and processes. -
Design and specify software components in accordance with a high-level architecture.
-
Plan, implement, and test software units, their integration, and the overall solution, using suitable tools and automation frameworks.
Our product stack mainly relies on:
-
SQL
-
Python
-
Java
-
JavaScript
-
Kubernetes
Tools include:
-
Jenkins for continuous integration
-
Gerrit and Git as source control systems
EDUCATION AND QUALIFICATIONS / SKILLS AND COMPETENCIES
Skills that we are looking for
-
Working knowledge of object-oriented SW design and programming, e.g. Java, C++
-
Working knowledge of Scrum and test-driven development
-
Working knowledge of database integration with SQL and object relational mapping tools
-
Working knowledge of source control systems
-
Understanding of databases and web application servers
-
Understanding of micro-service architecture
-
Fluent English (written and spoken)
-
German (mainly spoken)
Learning opportunities
-
SAP HANA
-
Retail business
-
Algorithms and data science
WORK EXPERIENCE
-
Bachelor or master degree in computer science or software engineering or equivalent
-
4+ years of professional experience in software development
WHAT YOU GET FROM US
Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own. A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment – apply now .
SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.
SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team (Americas: Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA: Careers@sap.com).
Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.

job.htmlcontent:
Requisition ID: 257286
Work Area: Software-Design and Development
Expected Travel: 0 - 10%
Career Status: Professional
Employment Type: Regular Full Time

 

COMPANY DESCRIPTION


SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.

SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.

PURPOSE AND OBJECTIVES

Now more than ever before businesses around the world need to accelerate the transformation of core processes in a flexible way. To support this, our business unit SAP S/4HANA Consumer Industries Cloud will focus on building new cloud products for customers in the Consumer Product, Retail, Wholesale and Life Science industries. 

 

Taking a start-up approach, SAP S/4HANA Consumer Industries Cloud will bring together product strategy and management with all the necessary cloud business functions such as architecture, engineering and operations. Development in this unit will focus on cloud-native applications. 

 

With a view of Lake Constance, the SAP office at Tägerwilen is home to a team of domain and engineering experts. Our focus is on forecasting, planning and replenishment uses cases in Retail and Consumer industries. In addition to the regular setup of Scrum teams, the engineering team includes data science experts to develop and make use of state-of-the-art scientific concepts. Embedded in the international setup of our business unit, we are collaborating with teams located in Germany, Canada, the United States, and China.

 

Join our team of highly motivated colleagues. We treat each other as equals, have an outstanding team spirit and a great working atmosphere. In your role as software engineer, you will contribute to the development of new products and features. You will work on all phases of the software development lifecycle and use the Scrum methodology and best practices for agile software development. . 

EXPECTATIONS AND TASKS 

You will be working in a cross-functional Scrum team. As software developer, you will directly contribute to the implementation and release of new products and product updates. More specifically, your tasks and responsibilities will include the following: 

  •  Analyze and understand business requirements and processes. 

  • Design and specify software components in accordance with a high-level architecture. 

  • Plan, implement, and test software units, their integration, and the overall solution, using suitable tools and automation frameworks. 

  

Our product stack mainly relies on: 

  • SQL 

  • Python 

  • Java 

  • JavaScript 

  • Kubernetes 

 

Tools include: 

  • Jenkins for continuous integration 

  • Gerrit and Git as source control systems 

EDUCATION AND QUALIFICATIONS / SKILLS AND COMPETENCIES 

Skills that we are looking for

  • Working knowledge of object-oriented SW design and programming, e.g. Java, C++ 

  • Working knowledge of Scrum and test-driven development 

  • Working knowledge of database integration with SQL and object relational mapping tools 

  • Working knowledge of source control systems 

  • Understanding of databases and web application servers 

  • Understanding of micro-service architecture 

  • Fluent English (written and spoken) 

  • German (mainly spoken) 

Learning opportunities 

  • SAP HANA 

  • Retail business 

  • Algorithms and data science 

WORK EXPERIENCE 

  • Bachelor or master degree in computer science or software engineering or equivalent 

  • 4+ years of professional experience in software development 

WHAT YOU GET FROM US

Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own. A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment – apply now.

SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT
To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.

SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team (Americas: Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA: Careers@sap.com).

Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.

job.title: Senior Software Engineer
job.plaincontent:
Requisition ID: 257288 Work Area: Software-Design and Development Expected Travel: 0 - 10% Career Status: Professional Employment Type: Regular Full Time
COMPANY DESCRIPTION
SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.
SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.
PURPOSE AND OBJECTIVES
Now more than ever before businesses around the world need to accelerate the transformation of core processes in a flexible way. To support this, our business unit SAP S/4HANA Consumer Industries Cloud will focus on building new cloud products for customers in the Consumer Product, Retail, Wholesale and Life Science industries.
Taking a start-up approach, SAP S/4HANA Consumer Industries Cloud will bring together product strategy and management with all the necessary cloud business functions such as architecture, engineering and operations. Development in this unit will focus on cloud-native applications.
With a view of Lake Constance, the SAP office at Tägerwilen is home to a team of domain and engineering experts. Our focus is on forecasting, planning and replenishment uses cases in Retail and Consumer industries. In addition to the regular setup of Scrum teams, the engineering team includes data science experts to develop and make use of state-of-the-art scientific concepts. Embedded in the international setup of our business unit, we are collaborating with teams located in Germany, Canada, the United States, and China.
Join our team of highly motivated colleagues. We treat each other as equals, have an outstanding team spirit and a great working atmosphere. You will work on the topic of forecasting in Retail and Consumer Industry. In your role as senior software engineer, you will contribute to the development of new products and features, based on customers’ requirements and aiming for a wide range of use cases. You will work on all phases of the software development lifecycle and use the Scrum methodology and best practices of agile software development.
EXPECTATIONS AND TASKS
You will be working in a cross-functional Scrum team. You will directly contribute to the implementation and release of new products and product updates. More specifically, your tasks and responsibilities will include the following:
- Analyze and understand business requirements and processes. - Design and specify software components in accordance with a high-level architecture. - Plan, implement, and test software units, their integration, and the overall solution, using suitable tools and automation frameworks. - Additionally, you could take the role of the Scrum Master to facilitate the agile process and help the team to continuously improve it.
Our product stack mainly relies on:
- SAP HANA - SQL - C++
Tools include:
- Jenkins for continuous integration - Gerrit and Git as source control systems - Python for test automation - JIRA and Confluence for team collaboration
EDUCATION AND QUALIFICATIONS / SKILLS AND COMPETENCIES
Required skills
- Comprehensive knowledge of object-oriented SW design and programming, e.g. Java, C++ - Experience with data structures, algorithms and principles of object-oriented design - Experience with database integration with SQL and object relational mapping tools - Experience with Scrum, test-driven development, continuous integration and other best practices of agile software development - Experience with source control systems such as Git, Subversion, Perforce, etc - Fluent English (written and spoken)
Skills that would be a plus
- Experience with Jenkins, Gerrit, Git - Experience with software development on SAP HANA - Knowledge of statistical methods - Understanding of Retail business - German (mainly spoken)
WORK EXPERIENCE
- Bachelor or master degree in computer science or software engineering or equivalent - 7+ years of professional experience in software development
WHAT YOU GET FROM US
Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own. A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment – apply now .
SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.
SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team (Americas: Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA: Careers@sap.com).

job.title: Data Scientist
job.plaincontent:
Requisition ID: 257285 Work Area: Software-Design and Development Expected Travel: 0 - 10% Career Status: Professional Employment Type: Regular Full Time
COMPANY DESCRIPTION
SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.
SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.
PURPOSE AND OBJECTIVES
Now more than ever before businesses around the world need to accelerate the transformation of core processes in a flexible way. To support this, our business unit SAP S/4HANA Consumer Industries Cloud will focus on building new cloud products for customers in the Consumer Product, Retail, Wholesale and Life Science industries.
Taking a start-up approach, SAP S/4HANA Consumer Industries Cloud will bring together product strategy and management with all the necessary cloud business functions such as architecture, engineering and operations. Development in this unit will focus on cloud-native applications.
With a view of Lake Constance, the SAP office at Tägerwilen is home to a team of domain and engineering experts. Our focus is on forecasting, planning and replenishment uses cases in Retail and Consumer industries. In addition to the regular setup of Scrum teams, the engineering team includes data science experts to develop and make use of state-of-the-art scientific concepts. Embedded in the international setup of our business unit, we are collaborating with teams located in Germany, Canada, the United States, and China.
Join our team of highly motivated colleagues. We treat each other as equals, have an outstanding team spirit and a great working atmosphere. In your role as data scientist, you will contribute to the design and integration of data science/mathematical methods into new products. You will work closely together with product management, developers and end users to create solutions of high quality.
EXPECTATIONS AND TASKS
You will be working in a cross-functional Scrum team, following the principles of agile software development. As data scientist, you will create concepts to solve complex data science/optimization problems and help with the implementation as a product, product feature respectively. More specifically, your tasks and responsibilities will include the following:
- Analyze and understand business requirements and processes. - Design and implement prototypes - Evaluate data science/mathematical concepts with real-life data - Help the team to implement these concepts as product features - Validate the quality of product features with regards to the business requirements - Communicate the scientific background of features internally and externally
From a technical perspective, our data science stack is built on:
- SQL - Python - R - Gurobi - Built-in capabilities of SAP HANA, e.g. OFL and PAL
Applicable methods include (but are not limited to):
- Classification and regression analysis - Bayesian statistics - Time series analysis and forecasting - Mathematical optimization
EDUCATION AND QUALIFICATIONS / SKILLS AND COMPETENCIES
Skills that we are looking for
- Knowledge of statistics, time series analysis and forecasting and/or optimization - Experience with predictive statistics, machine learning, data science and data mining - Experience with R, Python, Julia and/or SQL - Fluent English (written and spoken) - German (mainly spoken)
Learning opportunities we are providing
- Business knowledge of Retail and Consumer Industries - SAP product portfolio and technology - Agile software development - Forecasting
WORK EXPERIENCE
- Master’s degree or PhD with mathematical background, e.g. computer science, math, statistics, physics or equivalent - 2+ years of working experience in a development or academic environment
WHAT YOU GET FROM US
Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own. A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment – apply now .
SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.
SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team (Americas: Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA: Careers@sap.com).
Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.
Additional Locations :
Job Segment: Database, Scientific, Engineer, ERP, Embedded, Engineering, Technology

WHAT YOU GET FROM US

Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own. A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment – apply now.

SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT
To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.

SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team (Americas: Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA: Careers@sap.com).

Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.

Additional Locations: 


Job Segment:Database, Scientific, Engineer, ERP, Embedded, Engineering, Technology

job.title: Sachbearbeiter Immobilienbewirtschaftung (m/w/d)
job.plaincontent:
Immobilienzukunft gemeinsam gestalten
Wincasa, der führende Schweizer Immobilien-Dienstleister, bietet mittels eines flächendeckenden Standortnetzes ein ganzheitliches Dienstleistungsportfolio von der Planung über den Bau und die Bewirtschaftung, bis hin zur Revitalisierung und Repositionierung an.
Als grösster Immobilien-Bewirtschaftungsdienstleister von anspruchsvollen Wohn- sowie Büro- und Gewerbeflächen, bieten wir unseren Kunden ein umfassendes rundum Servicepaket an. Zur Ergänzung unseres Teams in der Filiale Winterthur suchen wir eine motivierte und engagierte Person als
Sachbearbeiter Immobilienbewirtschaftung (m/w/d)
Deine Aufgaben
- Mitwirken bei der gesamten Vermietung (Inserate, Verträge, Kündigungen, etc.) - Diverse Korrespondenz und telefonischer Kontakt zu Mietern, Hauswarten, Handwerkern und Behörden - Verarbeitung des Zahlungsverkehrs inkl. Kontierungen (Debitoren/Kreditoren) - Erledigung des Mahn- und Betreibungswesens - Unterstützung der Bewirtschaftung bei sämtlichen Aufgaben
Dein Profil
- Abgeschlossene kaufmännische Grundausbildung (E-Profil) - Erste kaufmännische Berufserfahrung (von Vorteil in der Immobilienbranche) - Gute Kenntnisse in MS-Office sowie digitale Affinität - Hohe Dienstleistungsorientierung - Selbständige und strukturierte Arbeitsweise - Engagierte/r und motivierte/r Teamplayer/in
Unser Angebot
- Fundiertes Einführungsprogramm, mit der Möglichkeit von internen Kursbesuchen - Strukturierte Arbeitsabläufe und professionelle Arbeitsinstrumente - Dynamisches Umfeld - interessante Weiterbildungs- und Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten - Attraktive Nebenleistungen - Moderner Arbeitsplatz Nähe Bahnhof
Für allfällige Fragen steht Dir unser Recruiting-Hotline-Team unter der Telefonnummer +41 (0)52 268 98 80 gerne zur Verfügung.
(Für diese Rekrutierung berücksichtigen wir nur Direktbewerbungen.)
Möchten Sie Ihre Erfahrungen und Kompetenzen in einem zukunftsorientierten Umfeld einbringen und aktiv an der Entwicklung von Wincasa mitwirken? Wir freuen uns auf Ihre aussagekräftige Online-Bewerbung. Für allfällige Fragen steht Ihnen unser Recruiting-Hotline-Team unter der Telefonnummer +41 (0)52 268 98 80 gerne zur Verfügung.
Weitere Stellen Unsere Benefits Wincasa Home

job.title: Solution Manager EMEA BD Cato
job.location: Eysins, Canton of Vaud; San Agustín del Guadalix, Madrid; Voisins-le-Bretonneux, Île-de-France Region; Amsterdam, North Holland; Frankfurt am Main, Hesse; Winnersh, England; Milan, Lombardy; Stockholm, Stockholm
job.plaincontent:
Job ID R-365550 Date posted 03.06.2020BACK TO SEARCH RESULTSApply
Solution Manager EMEA: BD Cato
Job Description Summary
Job Description
Solution Manager EMEA: BD Cato
Any BD European location
A superb, wide-ranging Solution Manager EMEA: BD Cat o career development role with BD, a global leader in Medical Technology.
Company Overview
BD is a leading global medical technology company that develops, manufactures and sells medical devices, instrument systems and reagents. BD is focused on improving drug delivery, enhancing the quality and speed of diagnosing infectious diseases and cancers, and advancing research, discovery and production of new drugs and vaccines.
In MMS, we have a single minded focus on improving the end to end medication management process from prescription all of the way to administration; enhancing safety and efficiency at every step along the way. Everyone from the pharmacy technician to the nurse at the bedside face thousands of decisions every day that can impact the safety of both their patients and themselves. We believe that by looking beyond technologies and at the entire system of medication management processes we can reduce the chance of medication errors, and deliver efficiency.
Cato Software Solutions is part of BD Medical and provides a suite of comprehensive medication safety solutions for oncological therapy planning and the preparation of cytotoxins and other critical IV compounds. With a success story that began more than 10 years ago, cato® is being used in many renowned hospitals all over Europe.
Role Overview
Design and deliver end to end customer medication management solutions with BD Cato technologies as an integral part. Solutions will be designed following analysis and consideration of each customer’s clinical/operational/IT processes and focus on specific customer objectives and change drivers. It will be essential to partner with, and assist, the customer during the implementation phase to ensure full stakeholder understanding of new clinical workflows and their implications. Visit customers post-implementation to ensure continuity of adoption, technology optimization and achievement of clinical objectives.
Main Responsibilities
- Design medication management solutions for customers adopting BD Cato and BD oncology solution workflows. Ensure full integration of clinical workflows and technology components of projects. - Provide professional, process-focused pre-Sales customer support and education. Help current and future customers understand the impact and value of an end-to-end automated IV processes. - Work closely with the EMEA marketing team to design and develop customer facing materials, event management and other customer engagement and promotional opportunities. - Play an active role in project implementation including clinical validation processes to ensure accuracy of processes and the full and proper integration of existing clinical workflows and IT systems. - Track and measure projects using a CRM database. - Support commercial teams, customers and business partners, providing professional support and technology optimization assessments. - Collaborate with customers to produce testimonials, process-transformation studies and ‘White Papers’, to further explain and promote adoption of BD dispensing solutions. - Create a pan-European network of flagship reference centres and professional KOL advocates.
Duties / Accountabilities
This provides the general requirements of the role but is not exhaustive.
- Pre-sales
- Undertake workflow analysis in order to understand current workflows from Prescribing-Compounding and administration. - Consult with customer Pharmacy, Consultants, Procurement/Purchasing, IT, Materials, Supply Chain, Finance and Executive personnel on automation-related change management and clinical process re-engineering requirements - Design future solution and gain buy-in from multi-stakeholder customers. - Support the sales team in tender preparation and creation of commercial terms
- Peri-implementation
- Support Implementation Process Manager/ Project manager by leading Design decisions, Policy and Procedures development & clinical validation of interfaces as appropriate.
- Post-implementation
- System optimization: regular ‘health checks’/validation support - Identification and positioning of expansion potential.
- Regional Expert
- Train regional sales team on Cato technology, customer solutions & workflows - Develop regional standards & models as appropriate. - Align with the Solution Management Office, Marketing, R&D and Product Development to ensure current and future Cato offerings evolve with changing customer needs and priorities. - Ensure the continuous evolution, development and improvement of the clinical process and technology knowledge base. Actively share best practice with technical and commercial teams and participate in certified educational programs, research opportunities, and clinical seminars as appropriate. - Identify and nurture relationships with key thought-leading and high profile professionals. Create a strong bench of highly credible, professional advocates for BD’s Cato based technology and solutions.
- Reference Site Development
- Support local Sales team in identifying and developing reference sites that demonstrate BD dispensing solutions effectively. - Work with these reference sites to ensure optimum usage and relevance to the local market(s). - Actively contribute to the on-going development of BD Dispensing International marketing collateral such as customer case studies, clinical process bench-marking, and medication and supply consumption trends analyses.
Skills
- High degree of cultural awareness and ability to work both independently and as part of a dynamic and high-performing cross-functional team. - Able to build strong and enduring customer relationships based on highly developed interpersonal skills and professional experience and credibility. - Excellent organizational, project management, presenting and influencing skills - Comfortable challenging the “status-quo” and in motivating teams for achievement of project objectives. - Open, clear and consistent communication skills
Qualifications & Experience
- Bachelor’s degree/Masters in Pharmacy and 3+ years relevant clinical experience. Experience with medical oncology a bonus. - Experience managing projects and success in motivating clinical teams to achieve shared objectives. - Sales, project management and/or customer relationship management experience would be highly beneficial. - Familiar with and competent on Microsoft packages - Proficient working clinical English, spoken and written - Willingness to travel frequently. Variable intensity, pan-EMEA, max 70%.
Additional (not essential)
- Languages: other European languages advantageous
It’s a superb, all-ro und Solution Manager EMEA: BD Cato career development role with a world leader in medical devices. So if this describes you and your aspirations, then please click on the APPLY button.
Primary Work Location
CHE Eysins - Business Park Terre-Bonne
Additional Locations
ESP San Agustin del Guadalix, FRA Parkile, GBR Crawley, ITA Milano - Via Enrico Cialdini, NLD Amsterdam - Herikerbergweg, SWE Stockholm - Arstaangsvagen (inactive)

Company Overview

BD is a leading global medical technology company that develops, manufactures and sells medical devices, instrument systems and reagents. BD is focused on improving drug delivery, enhancing the quality and speed of diagnosing infectious diseases and cancers, and advancing research, discovery and production of new drugs and vaccines.

In MMS, we have a single minded focus on improving the end to end medication management process from prescription all of the way to administration; enhancing safety and efficiency at every step along the way.  Everyone from the pharmacy technician to the nurse at the bedside face thousands of decisions every day that can impact the safety of both their patients and themselves.  We believe that by looking beyond technologies and at the entire system of medication management processes we can reduce the chance of medication errors, and deliver efficiency.

Cato Software Solutions is part of BD Medical and provides a suite of comprehensive medication safety solutions for oncological therapy planning and the preparation of cytotoxins and other critical IV compounds. With a success story that began more than 10 years ago, cato® is being used in many renowned hospitals all over Europe.

Role Overview

Design and deliver end to end customer medication management solutions with BD Cato technologies as an integral part. It will be essential to partner with, and assist, the customer during the implementation phase to ensure full stakeholder understanding of new clinical workflows and their implications. Visit customers post-implementation to ensure continuity of adoption, technology optimization and achievement of clinical objectives.

  • Design medication management solutions for customers adopting BD Cato and BD oncology solution workflows. Ensure full integration of clinical workflows and technology components of projects.
  • Provide professional, process-focused pre-Sales customer support and education. Help current and future customers understand the impact and value of an end-to-end automated IV processes.

    • Undertake workflow analysis in order to understand current workflows from Prescribing-Compounding and administration.

    • Train regional sales team on Cato technology, customer solutions & workflows

    • Align with the Solution Management Office, Marketing, R&D and Product Development to ensure current and future Cato offerings evolve with changing customer needs and priorities.
    • Ensure the continuous evolution, development and improvement of the clinical process and technology knowledge base. Actively share best practice with technical and commercial teams and participate in certified educational programs, research opportunities, and clinical seminars as appropriate.
    • Identify and nurture relationships with key thought-leading and high profile professionals. Create a strong bench of highly credible, professional advocates for BD’s Cato based technology and solutions.
  • Reference Site Development
    • Support local Sales team in identifying and developing reference sites that demonstrate BD dispensing solutions effectively.
    • Work with these reference sites to ensure optimum usage and relevance to the local market(s).
    • Actively contribute to the on-going development of BD Dispensing International marketing collateral such as customer case studies, clinical process bench-marking, and medication and supply consumption trends analyses.

Skills

  • Able to build strong and enduring customer relationships based on highly developed interpersonal skills and professional experience and credibility.
  • Excellent organizational, project management, presenting and influencing skills
  • Comfortable challenging the “status-quo”  and in motivating teams for achievement of project objectives.
  • Open, clear and consistent communication skills

Qualifications & Experience

  • Bachelor’s degree/Masters in Pharmacy and 3+ years relevant clinical experience. Experience with medical oncology a bonus.
  • Experience managing projects and success in motivating clinical teams to achieve shared objectives.
  • Sales, project management and/or customer relationship management experience would be highly beneficial.
  • Familiar with and competent on Microsoft packages
  • Proficient working clinical English, spoken and written
  • Willingness to travel frequently. Variable intensity, pan-EMEA, max 70%.  

Additional (not essential)

  • Languages: other European languages advantageous

It’s a superb, all-round Solution Manager EMEA: BD Cato career development role with a world leader in medical devices.  So if this describes you and your aspirations, then please click on the APPLY button.
